page.title: 20RYE MEADS EAST
page.content: {SQUARE 3910}contains mainly Rye Park {Sewage Works}& gravel pits. The latter have filled with water forming small lakes used for sailing & fishing {(RECREATION).}The many fields in the area are put to grass; well fertilised from the sewage farm. {TRANSPORT:}Ryegate Farm is served by a small track (soon to be cut by the Stanstead Abbotts By-pass) just off a minor road which is an access road for the heavy goods traffic to the sewage farm & gravel pits, but also acts as an alternative route through Hoddesdon. The county boundary with Essex cuts across the SE corner & a railway line runs parallel on the Essex side, as does the River Stort (with lock). The gravel pits are still working with conveyor belts taking the gravel to the main sewage area.
